edu.cpp.cs.cs141.prog_assgmnt_final

Class Map

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cpp.cs.cs141.prog_assgmnt_final.Map
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Map
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class represents a Map; yet, it has a lot of fields and methods that make the game playable. Thus, this class can be seen as Map/sub-GameEngine class. This is where all the objects that are necessary components of the game are created. It contains move methods for Player and Enemies and their attack methods.
    Author:
    Seungyun
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • ableEnemyAttack

        private boolean ableEnemyAttack
        This field depends on the invincibility power-up. When the player consumes the invincibility power-up, this field's value becomes false in order to disable enemyAttack method. Otherwise, it stays as true.

      • northSideOfRoom

        private boolean northSideOfRoom
        This field represents whether or not the player is located on northside of a room.

      • hardMode

        private boolean hardMode
        This field represents whether or not the game is in hard mode. True means hard mode and false mean normal mode.

        public void enemyVisibilityDown(edu.cpp.cs.cs141.prog_assgmnt_final.GameEntity enemy)

        Parameters:

      • checkVisibilityHardMode

        public void checkVisibilityHardMode(boolean playerLeft,
                                    boolean playerRight,
                                    boolean playerUp,
                                    boolean playerDown,
                                    edu.cpp.cs.cs141.prog_assgmnt_final.GameEntity enemy)
        This method decides where the enemies should move unto. If any of them finds the player in any direction, then they will move to the corresponding direction to follow the player. If they do not find the player, then they will move randomly.
        Parameters:
        playerLeft - if the player is on the left side tiles
        playerRight - the player is on the right side tiles
        playerUp - if the player is on the top side tiles
        playerDown - if the player is on the bottom side tiles
        enemy - each element in holdEnemy

      • enemyHardModeMove

        public void enemyHardModeMove(boolean playerLeft,
                              boolean playerRight,
                              boolean playerUp,
                              boolean playerDown,
                              boolean hardModePlayerNotFound,
                              edu.cpp.cs.cs141.prog_assgmnt_final.GameEntity enemy,
                              int i)
        This method allows the enemies to move in hard mode. They follow the player once they locate the player; otherwise, they move randomly until they find the player.
        Parameters:
        playerLeft - if the player is on the left side tiles
        playerRight - the player is on the right side tiles
        playerUp - if the player is on the top side tiles
        playerDown - if the player is on the bottom side tiles
        hardModePlayerNotFound - if they did not find the player
        enemy - each element in holdEnemy
        i - integer value for a 'for-loop'

      • smartMove

        public void smartMove(edu.cpp.cs.cs141.prog_assgmnt_final.GameEntity enemy,
                      int direction)
        This method lets the enemies to move in a smart way.
        Parameters:
        enemy - each element in holdEnemy
        direction - direction where they want to move

      • hardMode

        public void hardMode()
        This method represent hard mode. Now the enemies do not move randomly unless they do not find the player, but once they find the player they will follow the player.

      • isPlayerDetect

        public boolean isPlayerDetect()
        This method returns the value of dangerAhead, either true or false. If it's true, then enemies have been sighted by the player.
        Returns:
        the value of dangerAhead, either true or false

      • setPlayerDetect

        public void setPlayerDetect(boolean danger)
        This method sets the value of dangerAhead, either true or false.
        Parameters:
        danger, - either true or false

      • generateEmptySpace

        public void generateEmptySpace()
        This method fills the map with empty spaces to initialize the map.

      • generateRoomsWithBriefCase

        public void generateRoomsWithBriefCase()
        This method generates 9 nine rooms and only one of them has the brief case. A number will be generated randomly, depending on the number, one of the room is selected to contain the brief case.

      • generatePlayer

        public void generatePlayer()
        This method generates the player's character at position (8,0) which is the initial/starting position.

      • generateEnemy

        public void generateEnemy()
        This method generates 6 enemies. Each enemy's position is generated randomly and the 'if statement' filters positions where enemies cannot be located. When invalid position is generated and skips an element in the holdEnemy array, --i in 'else' will make the value of i go back to its previous value.

      • generatePowerUps

        public void generatePowerUps()
        This method generates 3 power-ups. Each power-up's position is generated randomly and the 'if statement' filters positions where power-ups cannot be located. When invalid position is generated and skips an element in the holdEnemy array, --i in 'else' will make the value of i go back to its previous value.

      • checkPositionOfPlayer

        public boolean checkPositionOfPlayer(int row,
                                     int column)
        This method checks if the player is located on the northside of a room.
        Parameters:
        row - index number
        column - index number
        Returns:
        the value of checkPosition, either true or false

      • checkSideOfRoom

        public boolean checkSideOfRoom(int row,
                               int column)
        This method takes row and column as an argument and if the player is located on the northside of a room, it returns northSideOfRoom as true; otherwise, false. Then, the player will be asked whether or not to check the room.
        Parameters:
        row - index number
        column - index number
        Returns:
        the value of northSideOfRoom, either true or false

      • detectBriefCase

        public boolean detectBriefCase(int row,
                               int column)
        This method takes row and column as an argument and checks if the room that the player wants to check has the briefcase. If the room has the briefcase, it returns briefCaseIndicator as true; otherwise, false.
        Parameters:
        row - index number
        column - index number
        Returns:
        the value of briefCaseIndicator, either true or false

      • searchRoom

        public boolean searchRoom(boolean northSideOfRoom)
        This method allows the player to search the rooms. If the room has the briefcase, it will give briefCaseIndicator as true; otherwise, false.
        Parameters:
        northSideOfRoom, - either true or false
        Returns:
        the value of northSideOfRoom, either true or false

      • detectPowerUps

        public void detectPowerUps(int row,
                           int column)
        This method takes row and column as an argument and checks if the player's new location has one of te power-ups. If it does, then it returns one of the power-up indicator as true; otherwise. false.
        Parameters:
        row - index number
        column - index number

      • useInvincible

        public boolean useInvincible(int invincibleTurns)
        This method makes the player to use the invincible power-up as soon as he or she consumes it. Then, the player will be invincible for 5 turns by disabling eneny's attack method, returning ableEnemyAttack as true. Otherwise, false.
        Parameters:
        invincibleTurns, - remaining turns
        Returns:
        the value of ableEnemyAttack, either true or false

      • invincibleTurns

        public int invincibleTurns()
        This method returns the number of remaining invincible turns.
        Returns:
        the number of remaining invincible turns

      • pickUpBullet

        public void pickUpBullet(boolean bulletIndicator)
        This method allows the player to pick up the additional bullet power-up. If the player has no bullet, then he or she gets one bullet; otherwise, no effect.
        Parameters:
        bulletIndicator, - either true or false

      • bullet

        public int bullet()
        This method returns how many bullet the player has.
        Returns:
        the number of bullet that that player has

      • checkBullet

        public boolean checkBullet()
        This method checks how many bullet the player has. If the player has 1 bullet, then the player is allowed to shoot; otherwise, the player cannot shoot. If the player can shoot, it returns playerAttack as true; otherwise, false.
        Returns:
        the value of playerAttack, either true or false

      • useBullet

        public void useBullet()
        This method consumes one bullet, when the player shoots.

      • shootLeft

        public void shootLeft()
        This method allows the player to shoot left. The for-loop checks the left sides of the player and if it finds a room or an enemy, the for-loop breaks. If it's an enemy, then it replace enemy with a new EmptySpace() with enemyDie() method.

      • shootRight

        public void shootRight()
        This method allows the player to shoot right. The for-loop checks the right sides of the player and if it finds a room or an enemy, the for-loop breaks. If it's an enemy, then it replace enemy with a new EmptySpace() with enemyDie() method.

      • shootUp

        public void shootUp()
        This method allows the player to shoot up. The for-loop checks the top sides of the player and if it finds a room or an enemy, the for-loop breaks. If it's an enemy, then it replace enemy with a new EmptySpace() with enemyDie() method.

      • shootDown

        public void shootDown()
        This method allows the player to shoot down. The for-loop checks the bottom sides of the player and if it finds a room or an enemy, the for-loop breaks. If it's an enemy, then it replace enemy with a new EmptySpace() with enemyDie() method.

      • enemyDie

        public void enemyDie(int row,
                     int column)
        This method replaces an enemy with a new EmptySpace(). It deletes a corresponding enemy from the holdEnemy array when 'if-statement' finds one.
        Parameters:
        row - Row index number of an enemy
        column - Column index number of an enemy

      • useRadar

        public void useRadar()
        This method allows the player to use the radar when the player consumes the radar power-up.

      • briefCaseRow

        public int briefCaseRow()
        This method returns the row index number of the briefcase when the player uses the radar.
        Returns:
        the row index number of the briefcase

      • briefCaseColumn

        public int briefCaseColumn()
        This method returns the column index number of the briefcase when the player uses the radar.
        Returns:
        the column index number of the briefcase

      • visibilityOfEnemyLeft

        public boolean visibilityOfEnemyLeft()
        This method allows enemies to check their left side tile to see if the player is there. It's surrounded by 'try and catch' to check other sides as well.
        Returns:
        foundPlayer, either true or false

      • visibilityOfEnemyRight

        public boolean visibilityOfEnemyRight()
        This method allows enemies to check their right side tile to see if the player is there. It's surrounded by 'try and catch' to check other sides as well.
        Returns:
        foundPlayer, either true or false

      • visibilityOfEnemyUp

        public boolean visibilityOfEnemyUp()
        This method allows enemies to check their top side tile to see if the player is there. It's surrounded by 'try and catch' to check other sides as well.
        Returns:
        foundPlayer, either true or false

      • visibilityOfEnemyDown

        public boolean visibilityOfEnemyDown()
        This method allows enemies to check their bottom side tile to see if the player is there. It's surrounded by 'try and catch' to check other sides as well.
        Returns:
        foundPlayer, either true or false

      • filterEmptySpace

        public boolean filterEmptySpace()
        This method filters if there is an EmptySpace in holdEnemy, then that EmptySpace cannot act like an enemy.
        Returns:
        foundPlayer, either true or false

      • visibilityOfEnemy

        public void visibilityOfEnemy()
                       throws java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
        This method combines all the visibilities of enemies. It throws an 'ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException' in order to handle unexpected exceptions.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - to catch exceptions not caught in the 'try-catch' blocks

      • enemyAttack

        public void enemyAttack(boolean foundPlayer)
        This method represents enemy attack and takes the boolean foundPlayer as an argument and if enemies find the player, then it creates new EmptySpace where the player was located.
        Parameters:
        foundPlayer, - either true or false

      • playerGotDamaged

        public void playerGotDamaged(boolean foundPlayer)
        This method damages the player when the enemies find the player.
        Parameters:
        foundPlayer - the value of foundPlayer, either true of false

      • initialPoint

        public void initialPoint()
        This method sends the player back to its initial point: Row = 8 and Column = 0, when it gets attacked by an enemy.

      • relocateEnemy

        public void relocateEnemy(boolean foundPlayer)
        * This method generates 6 enemies. Each enemy's position is generated randomly and the 'if statement' filters positions where enemies cannot be located. When invalid position is generated and skips an element in the holdEnemy array, --i in 'else' will make the value of i go back to its previous value.
        Parameters:
        foundPlayer - the value of foundPlayer, either true or false

      • playerImmediateLeftLook

        public void playerImmediateLeftLook()
        This method lets the player to have immediate left vision.

      • playerImmediateRightLook

        public void playerImmediateRightLook()
        This method lets the player to have immediate right vision.

      • playerImmediateUpLook

        public void playerImmediateUpLook()
        This method lets the player to have immediate up vision.

      • playerImmediateDownLook

        public void playerImmediateDownLook()
        This method lets the player to have immediate bottom vision.

      • playerImmediateLook

        public void playerImmediateLook()
        This method represents the player's immediate look. The player can see left, right, up, and down sides, but only one tile in each direction.

      • leftVisibilityOfPlayer

        public void leftVisibilityOfPlayer()
        This method lets the player to see two tiles ahead in left direction.

      • rightVisibilityOfPlayer

        public void rightVisibilityOfPlayer()
        This method lets the player to see two tiles ahead in right direction.

      • upVisibilityOfPlayer

        public void upVisibilityOfPlayer()
        This method lets the player to see two tiles ahead in up direction.

      • downVisibilityOfPlayer

        public void downVisibilityOfPlayer()
        This method lets the player to see two tiles ahead in down direction.

      • setNotFlipped

        public void setNotFlipped()
        This method sets everything to setFlipped(false) after the player takes an action.

      • movePlayer

        public boolean movePlayer(int movement)
        This method represents the player's movement. It moves the player in the direction that the user chooses. But it checks if that new location is an appropriate one.
        Parameters:
        movement - which gives new location for the player
        Returns:
        boolean value, either true or false, to check if it's a valid move

      • checkValidPosition

        public int checkValidPosition(int i)
        This method checks if enemies' new locations are good. Their new location is chosen randomly.
        Parameters:
        i - which is the index number of holdEnemy
        Returns:
        valid movement that enemies can use

      • moveEnemy

        public void moveEnemy()
        This method represents the movement of enemies. After getting valid movements from checkValidPostion method, enemies move to their new location randomly.

      • checkEnemyRemaining

        public int checkEnemyRemaining()
        This method checks how many enemies are there.
        Returns:
        number of remaining enemies

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        This method prints the map in String so that player can see and play the game.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A map that player plays on

      • printDebug

        public java.lang.String printDebug()
        This method is debug mode and prints the map in String. It shows all the position of the game entities.
        Returns:
        A map that shows every position of the game entities.
